meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an old-fashioned or conservative person.
meanings.sent1: The fogeyish gentleman always wore a suit and tie.
meanings.sent2: Her fogeyish taste in music leaned towards classical compositions.
meanings.sent3: The fogeyish professor insisted on using a chalkboard instead of a projector.
meanings.sent4: His fogeyish views on technology made him seem like a time traveler from the past.
meanings.sent5: The fogeyish decor of the room transported visitors to a bygone era.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a manner typical of an old person, especially in being overly traditional or set in one's ways.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa's fogeyish habit of reading the newspaper every morning never changed.
meanings.sent2: The fogeyish neighbor always complained about the noise from the kids playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The fogeyish cat refused to eat any food that wasn't served in its favorite bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her fogeyish insistence on handwritten letters seemed charmingly outdated.
meanings.sent5: The fogeyish routine of going to bed early and waking up at dawn was comforting to him.
